required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The Goal of the study is to identify trait-homogenous groups of cancer patients in regards to their physical activity associated health literacy. Based on these Groups, individualized exercise protocols and educative strategies can be developed which may increase the efficacy of the exercise therapy and increases the likelihood that patient get involved in physical activity.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Identification of different, trait-homogenous patient clusters

secondary_outcome.measure: Questionnaire: Physical Activity Associated Health Literacy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: To assess physical activity-associated health competence the recently developed and validated questionnaire from Sudeck and Pfeifer (2016) will be used

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: To assess health-literacy the recently developed and validated questionnaire from Sudeck and Pfeifer (2016) will be used

secondary_outcome.measure: Questionnaire: Health Related Quality of Life
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of Life will be assessed with the validated 30-item self-assessment questionnaire of the European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC QLQ-C30, version 3.0).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: To asses fatigue patients will be asked to complete the 12-item EORTC QLQ-FA12 (FA = fatigue), which is a newly developed questionnaire which has been intensively validated

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Patient's level of physical activity will be assessed with the SQUASH Physical Activity Questionnaire. It includes multiple activities referring to a 'normal' week. Activity dimensions asked include actively commuting physical activity (walking, cycling), physical activity at work or school, household activities, leisure time activities (sports, walking, gardening, cycling).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Emotion thermometers are four-domain visual-analogue scale including distress, anxiety, depression, and anger. Each domain is rated on an 11-point (0 to 10) Likert scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Bone pain will be assessed with the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI). This is a valid and reliable tool for pain measurement in cancer patients with bone metastases. It measures both pain severity and pain interference on function

intervention.description: Patient fill out a survey containing: Demographic Information, medical history, several Questionnaires about Health Literacy, Well Being/HRQoL and Fatigue

study_pop.textblock: Mixed Cohort of adult cancer patients undergoing treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically confirmed cancer diagnosis
- Females and males ≥18 years of age
- Undergoing either chemo-, immune-, radio- or anti-hormonal treatment
- Last surgery more than 6 weeks in the past
- Ability to understand English or German
- Be able to provide and understand informed consent
- Have an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Score of ≤ 2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Heart insufficiency > NYHA III (New York Heart Association) or uncertain arrhythmia
- Uncontrolled hypertension
- Severe renal dysfunction (GFR < 30%, Creatinine> 3mg/dl)
- Reduced standing or walking
- Instable classified bone metastasis
- Current pregnancy
- Any other evidence in the medical record of an absolute contraindication for exercise

responsible_party.investigator_title: Head of Exercise Onoclogy, Principal Investigator, Associated Professor
